subject: Re: [junit] ExpectedException reset
msgSnippet: Tamas, If you put a System.out.println after your first call to throwNullPointer, you ll see that the test ends there.  The exception ends the test, and then
messageBody:
Tamas,

If you put a System.out.println after your first call to
throwNullPointer, you'll see that the test ends there. The exception
ends the test, and then the rule is happy, because it got the
exception it was looking for. This is the expected behavior.

David Saff

On Mon, Sep 27, 2010 at 7:59 AM, Tamas Paulo <Tamas_Paulo@...> wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I was using the the ExpectedException rule, and realized that after getting the expected exception it "sinks" every following exception, whats more I couldn't even reset it't expectations.
> Am I missing something, or is this the proper behavior?
>
> See the following code which runs successfully:
> public class Expect {
>
>      @Rule
>      public ExpectedException exception = ExpectedException.none();
>
>      @Test
>      public void test() throws Exception
>      {
>            exception.expect(NullPointerException.class);
>            throwNullPointer();
>            throwNullPointer();
>            throwException();
>            exception = ExpectedException.none();
>            throwNullPointer();
>            throwException();
>            exception = null;
>            throwNullPointer();
>            throwException();
>      }
>
>      private void throwNullPointer()
>      {
>            throw new NullPointerException();
>      }
>
>      private void throwException() throws Exception
>      {
>            throw new Exception();
>      }
> }
>
> Thanks in advance,
> Tamás
